text.tspan: System characterized via linear transfer functions.

Problem: Not all state information is directly observable.
In a double suspension, you might only
have sensors on one of the suspended masses.
It turns out that there is a systematic way to estimate
If your model does not match your system exactly, the resulting
state estimator and controller might not work.
(See paper by Ken Strain and Brett Shapiro,
and Fu's talk at the last GEO ISC meeting!)
This seems to be an area of active research: "robust control".
for interferometer lock acquisition - could be very interesting!)
How is system identification done in state space?
Our measurements are made in the time domain (step response)
or frequency domain (transfer functions). How do we use these
measurements to improve the state space models?
Control system design: an introduction to state-space-methods
